meanings.definition: Pretending to feel or have (an emotion or illness)
meanings.sent1: She was faking her smile to hide her sadness.
meanings.sent2: His faking illness didn't fool anyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat was faking being stuck in a tree for attention.
meanings.sent4: The actor's faking tears moved the audience.
meanings.sent5: The child's faking excitement was adorable.

meanings.sent1: The faking designer bags looked real.
meanings.sent2: The faking jewelry was cheaply made.
meanings.sent3: The faking painting fooled many art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The faking currency was discovered by the authorities.
meanings.sent5: The faking documents were used to deceive.

meanings.sent1: He was faking his interest in the conversation.
meanings.sent2: She was faking her signature on the contract.
meanings.sent3: The magician was faking his disappearance act.
meanings.sent4: The student was faking his excuse for being late.
meanings.sent5: The criminal was faking his innocence.
